multiblock.error.biggerreactors.no_rods: Reactors must have at least one fuel element.

multiblock.error.biggerreactors.fuel_rod: All fuel elements must extend from top of the reactor to the bottom (%d, %d, %d).
multiblock.error.biggerreactors.no_contr: All fuel elements must be topped with a control rod (%d, %d).
multiblock.error.biggerreactors.dangling: There appears to be another reactor inside this one, is something wrong? (%d, %d, %d).

multiblock.error.biggerreactors.no_rods: Reactors must have at least one fuel element
multiblock.error.biggerreactors.control_: Control rods can only be placed on the top of the reactor (%d, %d, %d)
multiblock.error.biggerreactors.fuel_rod: All fuel elements must extend from top of the reactor to the bottom (%d, %d, %d)
multiblock.error.biggerreactors.no_contr: All fuel elements must be topped with a control rod (%d, %d)
multiblock.error.biggerreactors.dangling: There appears to be another reactor inside this one, is something wrong? (%d, %d, %d)

screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.e:
RF Generation Rate
§7How much RF the reactor is generating.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.s:
Steam Generation Rate
§7How much steam the reactor is generating.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.f:
Fuel Usage Rate
§7How much fuel the reactor is consuming.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.r:
Reactivity Rate
§7How reactive the reactor is.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.f:
Fuel Mix
§7Ratio of fuel to waste inside the reactor.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.c:
Case Heat
§7How hot the reactor is.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.f:
Fuel Heat
§7How hot the fuel is.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.i:
Internal Battery
§7How much RF is stored internally.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.c:
Coolant Intake Tank
§7How much coolant is stored internally.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.s:
Steam Exhaust Tank
§7How much steam is stored internally.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_terminal.a:
Toggle Reactor Status
§7Turn the reactor on or off.

Toggle Waste Ejection
§7Set whether waste will be ejected automatically.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_control_ro:
Insert Rod
§7More insertion reduces reaction rate.
§8[Shift]: Insert by 10%.
§8[Ctrl]: Insert by 50%.
§8[Ctrl + Shift]: Insert by 100% (full insertion).
§8[Alt]: Apply to all rods.

Retract Rod
§7More insertion reduces reaction rate.
§8[Shift]: Retract by 10%.
§8[Ctrl]: Retract by 50%.
§8[Ctrl + Shift]: Retract by 100% (full retraction).
§8[Alt]: Apply to all rods.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_coolant_po:
Toggle Direction
§7Change which direction this port flows.
screen.biggerreactors.reactor_access_por:
Toggle Direction
§7Change which direction this port flows.

Toggle Output
§7Change what this port is outputting.

Eject All Waste
§7Manually eject all waste from the reactor.
tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.fuel_mode: §bThis option is only available for output ports.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.io.gui_ch:
§b"This GUI is missing the input slots!"
The I/O ports have been rewritten!
To insert/extract materials, use a
hopper or pipe.
Blades and coils cannot exist at the same rotor shaft position
Only one blade pack and one coil pack may exist at a time
All coil blocks must be in the 8 blocks closest to the turbine shaft
Turbines require exactly 2 rotor bearings, one at each end
tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.turbine.a:
§bActivate Turbine
Enables flow of intake fluid to rotor.
Fluid flow will spin up the rotor.

§bDeactivate Turbine
Disables flow of intake fluid to rotor.
The rotor will spin down.
tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.turbine.c:
§bEngage Coils
Engages the induction coils.
Energy will be extracted from
the rotor and converted to RF.
Energy extraction exerts
drag on the rotor, slowing
it down.

§bDisengage Coils
Disengages the induction coils.
Energy will not be extracted
from the rotor, allowing it
to spin faster.
tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.turbine.v:
§bVent Overflow Only
Dump excess exhaust fluids.
Excess fluids will be lost if
exhaust fluid tank is full.

§bVent All Exhaust
Dump all exhaust fluids.
The exhaust fluid tank
will not fill.

§bVent Nothing
Preserve all exhaust fluids.
Turbine will slow or halt fluid
intake if exhaust tank is full.
tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.turbine.f:
§bIncrease Max Flow Rate
Higher flow rates will increase rotor speed.
§8[Shift]: Increase by 10 mB/t.
§8[Ctrl]: Increase by 100 mB/t.
§8[Ctrl + Shift]: Increase by 1000 mB/t.

§bDecrease Max Flow Rate
Lower flow rates will decrease rotor speed.
§8[Shift]: Decrease by 10 mB/t.
§8[Ctrl]: Decrease by 100 mB/t.
§8[Ctrl + Shift]: Decrease by 1000 mB/t.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.turbine.t:
§bTachometer
Rotors perform best at
around 900 or 1800 RPM.
Rotors kept overspeed for
too long may fail.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.turbine.g:
§bFlow Rate Governor
Controls the maximum rate
at which the turbine will
process fluids.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.turbine.o:
§bTurbine Output
Turbines generate energy
via metal induction coils placed
around a spinning rotor.
More (or higher quality) coils
generate energy faster.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.turbine.r:
§bRotor Efficiency
Rotor blades can only capture
so much fluid per blade.
Efficiency drops if the flow
of input raises past capacity.
